tweets.content:
1/12ğŸ§µ
A complaint thread regarding:
@BackpackExchange improper profiteering through a massive market liquidation event on Oct.10 (UTC).
Subject: Formal Complaint â€“ Market Manipulation, Malicious Liquidations & Regulatory Breaches by
@BackpackExchange(backpack.app) 

2/12 ğŸ§µ
To:
@SECGov|@CFTC|@FinCENnews|@FBI|@MAS_sg|@ESMAComms
Also cc:
@Backpack |@Backpack_CN|@armaniferrante
Complainant: Chen Fang  ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡³
Email: wang1working@gmail.com
Date: Oct.19

3/12 ğŸ§µ
Summary 
This complaint concerns @Backpack, operated by @armaniferrante for its Oct.10 2025 (UTC)mass liquidations that allegedly wiped usersâ€”even neutral hedged positionsâ€”through manipulated internal pricing and defective risk controls. 

4/12 ğŸ§µ
Multiple users (notably @river_bluffer threads) document severe losses and non-transparent liquidation logic, suggesting market manipulation, operational negligence, and regulatory non-compliance. 

5/12ğŸ§µ
Key Allegations 
1.The difference between the futures and spot prices of SOL was more than 30%. causing margin calls on positions neutral to the broader market. My lost up to â€“$32000 on hedged trades. 
â†’ Possible SEC Rule 10b-5/CEA 6(c)(1) violations. jurisdiction claims.ï¼ˆé™„å›¾OKXå’ŒBPæœŸç°ä»·å·®å¯¹æ¯”ï¼‰

6/12ğŸ§µ
2.ADL & Risk-Control Failures ADL closed only derivative legs, leaving spot exposure. â€œSafe hedgeâ€ marketing misled users; insurance funds not applied. â†’ Misrepresentation / fraudulent inducement. 

7/12 ğŸ§µ
3.Liquidity Shortfalls & Artificial Wicks Empty order books on BTC/SOL pairs; no market-maker backup or circuit-breaker. 
â†’ Potential CEA 9(a) artificial-price creation.

8/12ğŸ§µ
4.Refusal to Compensate & Opaque Fees Support tickets closed; â€œKFC promotionâ€ mocked users. Liquidation fees raised 0.5%
â†’1% without notice or refund. â†’ Violates CFTC Reg. 1.55 / 17 CFR 166.3 (transparency & fair dealing).  

9/12 ğŸ§µ 
 5. CEO @armaniferrante promoted unified margin for efficient hedging (Jul 11, 2025), urging funds deposit. Poor risk controls led to neutral strategy liquidations. â†’ SEC Rule 10b-5 violation. 

10/12ğŸ§µ
Evidence (available on request)

â€¢Public threads by @river_bluffer show price gaps and user losses.
â€¢Screenshots: liquidation times, margin ratios, TX hashes, support IDs.
â€¢Archived ToS (Oct 2025) lacks multi-venue index or circuit breaker clauses.

11/12 ğŸ§µ
â€¢@Backpack posts advertising EU/US availability contradict

Requested Actions
1.Probe @Backpack's pricing & liquidation systems.
2.Check unregistered derivatives for US/EU/SG users.
3.Order restitution if violations found.
4.Coordinate with @MAS_sg & @ESMAComms.

12/12 ğŸ§µ
Reporter Details

Chen Fang |  China  |  Email wang1working@gmail.com Willing to submit complete records and sworn statement upon request.

Sincerely, 
Chen Fang
October 19, 2025

Subject: Formal Complaint â€“ Market Manipulation, Malicious Liquidations & Regulatory Breaches by @Backpack Exchange

To:
@SECGov   |  @CFTC   |  @FinCENnews   |  @FBI   |  @MAS_sg   |  @ESMAComms
Also cc: @Backpack | @Backpack_CN | @armaniferrante

Complainant: Joe shao ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸   Email: jwfv4n@163.com
Date: October 19, 2025

â¸»

Summary

This complaint concerns @Backpack, operated by @armaniferrante (backpack.app), for its October 11 2025 mass liquidations that allegedly wiped usersâ€”even neutral hedged positionsâ€”through manipulated internal pricing and defective risk controls.
Multiple users (notably @river_bluffer threads) document severe losses and non-transparent liquidation logic, suggesting market manipulation, operational negligence, and regulatory non-compliance.

â¸»

Key Allegations
1.Manipulated Liquidation Prices
Internal spot quotes deviated 20â€“24%, causing margin calls on positions neutral to the broader market. Users lost up to â€“$39 000 on hedged trades.
â†’ Possible SEC Rule 10b-5 / CEA 6(c)(1) violations.
2.ADL & Risk-Control Failures
ADL closed only derivative legs, leaving spot exposure. â€œSafe hedgeâ€ marketing misled users; insurance funds not applied.
â†’ Misrepresentation / fraudulent inducement.
3.Liquidity Shortfalls & Artificial Wicks
Empty order books on BTC/SOL pairs; no market-maker backup or circuit-breaker.
â†’ Potential CEA 9(a) artificial-price creation.
4.Refusal to Compensate & Opaque Fees
Support tickets closed; â€œKFC promotionâ€ mocked users. Liquidation fees raised 0.5%â†’1% without notice or refund.
â†’ Violates CFTC Reg. 1.55 / 17 CFR 166.3 (transparency & fair dealing).

â¸»

Evidence (available on request)
â€¢Public threads by @river_bluffer show price gaps and user losses.
â€¢Screenshots: liquidation times, margin ratios, TX hashes, support IDs.
â€¢Archived ToS (Oct 2025) lacks multi-venue index or circuit breaker clauses.
â€¢@Backpack posts advertising EU/US availability contradict jurisdiction claims.

â¸»

Requested Actions
1.Investigate pricing, liquidation, and risk systems of @Backpack.
2.Assess offering of unregistered derivatives to US/EU/SG users.
3.Order restitution and publish investor alerts if violations confirmed.
4.Coordinate cross-border enforcement among @MAS_sg and @ESMAComms.

â¸»

Reporter Details

Joe shao  |  United States  |  Email jwfv4n@163.com
Willing to submit complete records and sworn statement upon request.

Sincerely,
Joe shao
October 19, 2025

tweets.author: LeotheHorseman

tweets.content:
I miss the old crypto.

Back then, it was full of addicts, weirdos, shitposters, and misfits who never quite fit into society. It was a cult of people who spoke up for bad taste, who reveled in nonsense and embraced absurdity. We found a place to hide inside this giant casino, and somehowâ€”even while losing moneyâ€”it felt like we were escaping the pain of real life for a while.
I was always the least cool kid in class, but I kind of loved being surrounded by bad kids and dumb narratives.

Now everything feels too polished, too righteous, too picture-perfect. Even though you know theyâ€™re still scammers, they dress like kings and talk like angels, and it leaves you nothing to fight back with.

Has the industry actually changed at all from four years ago? It doesnâ€™t seem like it. The same startup ideas, the same product designs, the same pump-and-dumps. The only difference is, they tell us the reason we didnâ€™t make it back then is because we werenâ€™t â€œchosenâ€â€”not from tradfi, not regulatory royalty like them. And maybe they did win, for now.

So what has crypto really brought to the world? If the answer is still just gamblingâ€¦ then I hope at least this casino can have more weird voices again. More outcasts, more chaos, more color. More CULTS.

I miss the old crypto.
